Sentencas: A parametric study of a solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine (SOFC-GT) hybrid system design is conducted with the intention of determining the thermodynamically based design space constrained by modern material and operating limits.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: The analysis is performed using a thermodynamic model of a generalized SOFC-GT system where the sizing of all components, except the fuel cell, is allowed to vary.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: Effects of parameters such as pressure ratio, fuel utilization, oxygen utilization, and current density are examined.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: Operational limits are discussed in terms of maximum combustor exit temperature, maximum heat exchanger effectiveness, limiting current density, maximum hydrogen utilization, and fuel cell temperature rise.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: It was found that the maximum hydrogen utilization and combustor exit temperature were the most significant constraints on the system design space.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: The design space includes the use of cathode flow recycling and air preheating via a recuperator (heat exchanger).
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: The effect on system efficiency of exhaust gas recirculation using an ejector versus using a blower is discussed, while both are compared with the base case of using a heat exchanger only.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: It was found that use of an ejector for exhaust gas recirculation caused the highest efficiency loss, and the base case was found to exhibit the highest overall system efficiency.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: The use of a cathode recycle blower allowed the largest downsizing of the heat exchanger, although avoiding cathode recycling altogether achieved the highest efficiency.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: Efficiencies in the range of 50-75% were found for variations in pressure ratio, fuel utilization, oxygen utilization, and current density.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space

Sentencas: The best performing systems that fell within all design constraints were those that used a heat exchanger only to preheat air, moderate pressure ratios, low oxygen utilizations, and high fuel utilizations.
Titulo: Parametric Thermodynamic Analysis of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Gas Turbine System Design Space
